utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I just came in because I've been having this cough that's getting worse over the last uh one and a half week and uh, I've also just recently in the last few days been getting some shortness of breath. Um and I also noticed uh my bowel movements have changed a little bit as well over the last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so yeah, let's break this down. The cough, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The cough, I think it started uh probably like around 10 days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: 10 days ago, OK, and how about the shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That just started in the last uh I think 3 days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then the the bowel bowel changes, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I think it also started in like, I would say, for the last three days I've been getting uh diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK OK, so let's go back to the cough, is it constant or um is it triggered by certain things like the cold air, dust, um you know, um, certain times of the day, like morning, evening?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I would say it's pretty pretty constant since the last like 10 days, uh it's, there's no real pattern to it, and I've mostly just been inside my house. I don't think there are any triggers or I don't own any pets or anything like that, no new rugs, like uh, no no new changes really in my house.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK and um have you tried anything to make it better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, not really. I I've done some uh home remedies like trying to do one of those steam steam masks and see if that helps, but it didn't really do anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and how about um the quality of that cough? Is it, does it sound harsh?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah I would say it's getting a little bit harsh. It's more just like, I'm not bringing anything up, it's more like a dry cough um, but yeah, I would say it's getting worse, definitely.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, is it a dry cough then, or are you producing a little bit of sputum or blood or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I haven't seen any blood at all and rarely do I bring like up some sputum, but like most of the time it's just a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, it's a dry cough. Um and would you say the cough's getting worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'd definitely say in the last um three to four days I've been just coughing nonstop, it's very irritating.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, have you experienced anything like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, probably a few years ago, I think I caught the flu or something and got really sick with a fever and just a lot of coughing. But since then, nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um the shortness of breath, 1 to 10, 10 being the worst, how bad is it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh probably like a five. It kind of just started out with uh, three days ago, was kind of like I just couldn't take deep breaths like I noticed that my breathing was getting a little bit more more shallow and now it's, especially when I'm coughing, it's like I really have to sit down and catch my breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, um does anything make the shortness of breath worse? Like I guess um you know exertion, uh laying down, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, not really. Maybe like sitting down helps sometimes, but even when I'm sitting down I'm still coughing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK and um do you have any wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, maybe from all the coughing, sometimes I feel like there's some pain there, but it's not not anything that's too painful.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um do you feel like your heart's racing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um have you noticed any swelling in your limbs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I didn't notice anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about um pain in your calves when you walk a few blocks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been fine that way.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not really, I I thought maybe with the shortness of breath that would happen, but like so far that hasn't happened to me..

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no I, maybe like a few chills, like I'm not sure actually, it was hard to tell, but I haven't had any fevers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, we'll take your temperature today just to make sure. Um any weight loss over the past few weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, probably weight gain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your hair, nails, or skin, like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no, that that's all been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about um loss of smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had uh, I think my taste and smell are still pretty good. No, no issues there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um have you had a runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no no congestion really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um have you had a sore throat at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um any issues swallowing food?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, changes in your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe just a little bit, like I don't really feel like eating when I'm coughing all the time, but other than that, no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Diarrhea, right. Um how often are you having a bowel movement right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say uh like I've been going, probably more than eight times a day, probably in the last few days like 10 times a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh wow, OK, and each time are you producing a lot of stool, or is it just a little bit each time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like a little bit, but it's mostly liquidy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any solids at all? Like is it semi solid at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um maybe a little bit, but mostly it's just liquid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any blood in the stool?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been checking uh no, I didn't notice any blood or change in colour. It's mainly just um liquid diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, um any confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um how about muscle aches or joint pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you otherwise healthy or do you have any long uh standing medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, so I do have diabetes and high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you take any medications for those conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so for diabetes I'm taking this medication called uh like I think metformin and then for the blood pressure, uh I think it's, I forgot the name, I think it's something like um ramipril or something like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yep, OK, and you're taking that um as directed, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been taking that regularly and my blood pressure, I've been measuring, it's been pretty steady, no changes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. Have you had any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did have my appendix removed, probably in my 20s, but uh that was the only thing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you on any other medications besides the ramipril and metformin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just uh like multi vitamins for men over 50.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um any family history of heart conditions or lung conditions that you know of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, so my family, like diabetes is pretty big, it runs in the family and uh my father in his 60s uh like died from a heart attack. Um other than that, not anything else I can think of, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any cancers in their family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I used to, I I quit probably five years ago, but before that I used to smoke probably a pack a day for more than 20 years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh OK, well good job for cutting down and quitting, um.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, um do you do marijuana at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no no no drugs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any other recreational drugs? You said no, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah no, no, I don't do any drugs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I probably have maybe um some whiskey maybe a couple times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, so yeah, I just live in the city in London uh in an apartment with my, just wife, my wife.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um is she also sick or is she OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, she's been completely fine, and I've been kind of isolating myself from her over the last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, well that's good and that's smart, um just because you don't know what you have, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah OK, do, can you think of any other sick contacts that you may have had over the past one or two weeks or even three weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I go to the grocery store, then I go to work, I haven't noticed anyone being sick at work, but you know, you never know like who comes in asymptomatic and like they might be carrying it, with this virus like mainly I'm worried about covid and you know just how fast that's spreading everywhere.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Um yeah, for sure, have you traveled to anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh we've been in Canada, Ontario, haven't left to go anywhere.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, well those are all the questions that I had for you. Did you have any questions or did you have any concerns, anything that you wanted to discuss today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah no, I just uh was wondering if I can get the covid test, that would just, I wanted to make sure I don't give anyone covid if I do have it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure, I think that's a good idea. Um so, and it's definitely something that we need to rule out, so we'll do a covid swab today um and you'll hear back within 24 to 48 hours, um but in the mean time, regardless of whether you actually have covid or not, because your symptoms overlap with covid, um it's good to isolate for 14 days and that includes trying to isolate from your wife as well if possible, and public health should be in touch if it's positive uh to do contact tracing. Um and if it's not covid, it's probably another viral illness that's going around at this time of year. Uh if your symptoms get worse, um you know you're having neurological symptoms or or if your fever gets really high, or you're having a lot of trouble breathing, then you should go see the ER. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My, if my breathing gets worse uh I'll just go to the emergency Department?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yes, please do.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, take care.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
